Once upon a time, there was a wealthy family who lived in a small village in a beautiful country. Each member of the family had a distinct and unique personality, and they were all very proud of their house.

One day, the father of the family was sitting in his study, engrossed in his latest novel, when he heard a loud knock on the front door. They introduced themselves as representatives of the surrounding countries, eager to make an alliance with the wealthy family, promising great wealth and resources to the family in return for their support.

The father was flattered and even more happy. He thanked the strangers and invited them for lunch. After the meal, the father shared his idea of how each member of the family could come together and make a powerful team, with a distinctive personality for each. The guests were enthusiastic and offered their assistance.

They helped the family establish their own country with the resources and soldiers they had pledged. The mother was a cunning politician and appealed for support in feeding the family, making alliances with neighboring countries and marketplaces. The father acted as a courageous soldier and protected all the members from where they were stationed. Mother Nature, a beautiful woman, was gifted with rare beauty, proved a wise instructor of the family's constantly growing children.

Soon enough, Mother Nature noticed that the mother was tending the gardens too much, neglecting the maintenance of the family home. So the family installed a new gardener. The son was too young to involve directly in the process, but he provided unique and creative ideas, leading to more fun activities for the whole family. So, we decided to move the son in the new garden.

The land began to sink and everyone rushed to the exit. But Mother Nature, being a girl and not immune to drama, was carrying a heavy stone on her shoulder and needed some help. Everyone rushed to help her, they divided the stone into three equal parts and everyone carried one part each and reached safety in time.

Everyone fell in love with the garden that their mother designed at first sight, boisterous and lonely alike. Slowly, the family began to settle down and embrace a happy and peaceful life. There was a young girl who once asked her father, "What happens when I die?" Her father, far from an expert in death, told her about the world of the "kupuok" where the souls of the dead slumber. However, that was not her end, as her soul seemed determined to explore. Her soul's wanderings took her far and wide, even through the gates of the Goddess Meohi.

One day on her journey, she encountered a village with many people. She inquired about the people around her, but they didn't answer for some reason. She made a seemingly innocent remark, and those standing near the river began to ask her the reason for her question. She explained, "If we are reborn and reincarnated, I wonder what kind of soul I will become? From what I know about reincarnation, some people (the children) do not remember their past lives. If a person dies, their soul ascends to the sky and remains above the clouds. The soul will descend to the land precisely where they were re-buried."

Upon saying her mother's name twice, she noticed that the mother was reborn in front of her eyes, even though they had been separated by death for a short while. Her mother was now working very hard in the fields, which puzzled the child. The village people then explained that children are not the same as adults straying from their original bodies. They mentioned that even when a child finally arrives in heaven, they still retain their original body.
